Palesa loves plants
 Ursula Nafula 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 This is Palesa. 
 
 Her name means ‘flower’ in 
 
 her language, Setswana. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 In the morning Palesa talks 
 
 to the orange tre. 
 
 "Orange tre, please give 
 
 us lots of oranges." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Palesa walks to schol. 
 
 On the way she says to the 
 
 gras, "Please gras, grow 
 
 grener and don’t dry up." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Palesa pases wild 
 
 flowers. "Flowers, thank 
 
 you for your bright colours." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 At schol, Palesa talks to 
 
 the litle tre. 
 
 "Tre, please grow big 
 
 branches so we can read 
 
 under your shade." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Palesa talks to the hedge 
 
 round her schol. 
 
 "Please grow strong and 
 
 stop bad people from 
 
 going inside." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When Palesa returns home 
 
 from schol, she visits the 
 
 orange tre. 
 
 "Are your oranges ripe yet?" 
 
 asks Palesa. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 "The oranges are stil 
 
 gren," sighs Palesa. 
 
 
 
 "I wil se you tomorow 
 
 orange tre," she says. 
 
 
 
 "Perhaps then you wil have 
 
 a ripe orange for me!"
